content:
Little etymological trivia: "Manufacture" has its roots in Medieval Latin "manufactura:" manu, ablative of manus "hand," and factura "a working," from past-participle stem of facere "to perform."

To make by hand.

Which is kind of ironic if you ask me.

content:
Another status update to Mastonaut!

After a long break in development mostly due to me moving apartments in Berlin, I‚Äôve started progressing in development again. One of the major features that is still lacking for version 1.0 is displaying profiles, and now this is closer to being done!

I‚Äôm not very happy with the looks of the profile view, so it is still going to be worked on.

I click "new tweet‚Äù on Google Chrome running on my Windows computer manufactured by Lenovo, right after I placed an order for an Alexa device from Amazon.

"Apple is such a terrible company that couldn't care less for its users" I type and hit send. I feel good.

content:
When I got my iPhone XS I felt that the battery life wasn‚Äôt great. Then I forgot about it for a while. Now I‚Äôve been using it heavily in these past days (working on preparing my new place for me to move in) and battery life has been excellent. The day it was lowest by the time I went to bed it was at 37%. Not bad at all.

Cheers to all the devs who work on improving this kind of thing every day.
